text:
What Sylvia's has represented
for all these years

Consistency doesn't mean
continuity of products.

It means consistency of a safe
place to go with good food,

with nice people,
and the people that

are going to take care of you
in the restaurant really care.

She not only did
what she had to do,

but she became a Black business
owner of not just a restaurant,

but real estate in a time when
that just wasn't happening.

To do that and then still
be around is truly amazing.

It's much more likely to
have a restaurant fail

But to make it this
many generations

and still have the consistency
of warmth and safety is--
